tournament.name: Thursday 4th Qualifier for MagicFest Online Season 2

decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast powerful spells for free, allowing the player to control the game by efficiently managing their resources. The deck includes powerful control cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset of the Ancient Way, along with board wipes like Deafening Clarion to keep the opponent's board in check. The deck also includes strong finishers like Cavalier of Flame and Sphinx of Foresight to close out the game quickly once the player has established control.

This deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells without having to pay their mana cost. It includes a variety of control elements such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion to help control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Cavalier of Flame and Sphinx of Foresight to quickly close out the game. Additionally, the inclusion of Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion adds card advantage and consistency to the deck. Overall, the deck aims to control the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while maintaining control over the game through removal and powerful creatures. The deck includes a variety of creatures with abilities that can generate value over time and put pressure on the opponent, as well as removal spells to deal with threats. By managing resources effectively and strategically deploying its threats, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through a combination of control and aggression.

The deck focuses on aggressively cycling through cards to generate tokens and draw more cards, while utilizing Zenith Flare as a finisher to deal damage based on the number of cards in the graveyard. It also includes cards like Improbable Alliance and Ominous Seas to create additional tokens for offensive pressure. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of creature tokens, direct damage, and card advantage to quickly close out games.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build a board presence through creating tokens and using powerful aggressive creatures to pressure the opponent. Cards like Winota, Joiner of Forces and Legion Warboss allow for explosive turns and the potential to overwhelm the opponent with impactful creatures. Agent of Treachery provides a powerful late-game threat. The deck also includes cards for versatility and card advantage, such as Charming Prince and Elite Guardmage. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain a strong board presence to secure a victory.

This deck aims to control the game by using a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis. With Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion, the deck is able to generate extra value by blinking its powerful permanents like Omen of the Sea and Elspeth Conquers Death. The deck focuses on ramping into its big threats with cards like Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Shatter the Sky.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing cycling cards to trigger Zenith Flare, dealing damage to the opponent and gaining life. The deck includes a mix of cheap creatures and cycling spells to maintain high tempo and pressure on the opponent. Lurrus of the Dream-Den is included as a companion to provide additional value by recurring low-cost cycling cards from the graveyard. The deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and burn spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing the Fires of Invention card to cast powerful spells for free. It includes a mix of powerful creatures and planeswalkers to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategies. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage and overwhelming them with efficient threats. The inclusion of Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion allows the player to draw additional cards while still adhering to the deck's strategy of playing high-impact spells.

The deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to play powerful spells for free, allowing the player to control the game and outvalue their opponent. The deck includes a variety of powerful threats such as Cavalier of Flame and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, as well as strong removal options like Bonecrusher Giant and Deafening Clarion. The goal is to stabilize the board with efficient removal and card advantage through cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Elspeth Conquers Death, eventually overwhelming the opponent with big threats like Genesis Ultimatum.

This deck utilizes Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells each turn without using mana. It focuses on controlling the board with removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Shark Typhoon while generating card advantage through planeswalkers like Narset and Teferi. The deck also includes a companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, for additional value by flickering permanents. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's three-color requirements, with lands that provide flexibility and utility. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells and card advantage.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by utilizing Fires of Invention to cast spells for free and deploy powerful threats on the board. The deck includes a mix of removal spells, card draw, and high-impact creatures like Sphinx of Foresight, Cavalier of Flame, and Kenrith, the Returned King. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal while generating card advantage and applying pressure with strong creatures. Keruga, the Macrosage serves as a companion for additional card draw and deck consistency.

The main focus of this Jeskai Control deck is to maintain control of the board by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and wiping the board when necessary. It also aims to generate card advantage with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Shark Typhoon, while also utilizing efficient removal spells like Scorching Dragonfire and Deafening Clarion. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Elspeth Conquers Death and Teferi, Time Raveler to help close out the game. The deck is well-rounded and looks to outvalue the opponent through careful resource management and strategic plays.
